metadata.Title: CVE-2023-21400 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - high
metadata.Description:
In multiple functions of io_uring.c, there is a possible kernel memorycorruption due to improper locking. This could lead to local escalation ofprivilege in the kernel with System execution privileges needed. Userinteraction is not needed for exploitation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-21400` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-82-generic - 5.15.0-82.91
linux-image-5.15.0-82-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-82.91
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-82-generic - 5.15.0-82.91
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-82-generic-64k - 5.15.0-82.91
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1040-kvm - 5.15.0-1040.45
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1043-aws - 5.15.0-1043.48
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-82.91').
